titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Centennial Dukes Scrapbook, 2004-2005
titlestmt.subtitle: Centennial Dukes Scapbook SC 5057

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The Centennial Dukes Scrapbook Collection is a scrapbook that gathers all of the main aspects of the freshman year of the class of 2008, better known as the centennial dukes. The scrapbook contains ten sections that address all of the major events of the 2004-2005 academic school year.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of Item], The Centennial Dukes Scrapbook, 2004-2005, SC# 5057, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to Special Collections by the James Madison University Alumni Office on October, 2012.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection was created by the Centennial Dukes organization for the class of 2008 which specifically documented their freshman year of 2004-2005. The organization was tracking the four years of the class of 2008.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Contents of the scrapbook have been removed from the original binder and rehoused in acid-free folders. Arrangement of the folders reflects the original order of sections within the scrapbook.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: James Madison University celebrated its 100th anniversary in 2008. As part of the celebration, the university decided to chronicle the happenings of the class of 2008, often referred to as the Centennial Dukes. Students volunteered to write memories of their experiences from the start of their JMU career in 2004, until their graduation in 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Centennial Dukes Scrapbook, 2004-2005, consists of 1.7 linear feet of material. Within this collection there are various pictures, newspaper clippings, magazine clippings, photographs, quotations, facts, captions, and writings that relate to the section that they are placed in. The scrapbook is organized into ten sections and each section was put into its own folder. The scrapbook follows a basic organizational structure in that each section has a title page followed by pages of information that relate to the general topic of the section. The scrapbook was created by the Centennial Dukes organization and it was created mostly by students with the supervision of a few faculty members. The use of the scrapbook was to document the freshman year of the class of 2008 and after they left it was meant to tell the story of what occurred in their freshman year in the form of visual and written explanation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The contents of this collection are all within one series split into ten different folders. The folders are arranged according to how the scrapbook was originally set up with each folder being a separate section of the scrapbook.
The collection is arranged in one series:

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: See also the JMU Yearbook Collection Online; The Madison Century Website http://www.jmu.edu/centennialcelebration/
